page.title: 18LOCAL NEWS HOSP. TO CLOSE(2)
page.content: The Local Health Authority says Thope Maternity Hospital must go because it is isolated from the maternity services at Sunderland and this does cause travel problems for anaethetists consultants and paedatrictians. The M.P. for Easington said the location is ideal and it would be highly inconvenient and to expensive for expectant mothers to travel to Sunderland and Hartlepool.The reasons given by Sunderland Health Authority for closing the hospital,were said to be unconvincing. The Health Authority's report did admit that travelling times would be longer,fares more expensive for patients but it stated that the facilities at Sunderland District Hospital and the Cameron Hospital in Hartlepool would be extended at a cost of Â£1.5 million.
